# 4.5
```{r}
chr <- c('C','C','C','A','C','A','A','B','B','B','B','C')
as.factor(chr) # factor(chr)
table(chr) # table on character vector
table(as.factor(chr)) # class conversion
factor(
  chr, levels=c("C","B","A")
)
```

```{r}
{
  # do table count on chr
  table(chr) -> tb_chr
  tb_chr
  # ask computer to figure out the level sequence
  sort(tb_chr, decreasing=T) -> sorted_tb_chr
  sorted_tb_chr
  # ask computer to give us names after sorting
  names(sorted_tb_chr)
}
```

```{r}
newLevels <- 
{
  # table check
  table(chr) -> tb_chr
  # sort in decreasing order
  sort(tb_chr, decreasing=T) -> sorted_tb_chr
  sorted_tb_chr
  # take out table item names
  names(sorted_tb_chr)
}
fct_chr <- factor(chr, levels=newLevels)
```

```{r}
newLevels <- 
{
  # table check
  table(chr) -> tb_chr

  sort(tb_chr, decreasing=T) -> sorted_tb_chr
  sorted_tb_chr

}

table(fct_chr)
```

## 4.5.1
```{r}
f(x) # the same as
x |> f() # read as use x to do f

g(x, y) # the same as
x |> g(y)

g(f(x), y) # the same as
g(x |> f(x), y) # the same as
x |> f(x) |> g(y) # read as use x to do f, then (take the result) to do g
```

```{r}
x |> f() |> g(y) |> h(z)
# use x to do f, then take the result
# to do g, then take the result
# to do h
```

```{r}
newLevels <- 
{
  # table check
  chr |> table() |> 
  # sort in decreasing order
  sort(decreasing=T) |>
  # take out table item names
  names()
}
fct_chr <- factor(chr, levels=newLevels)
table(fct_chr)
```

### %<>%
```{r}

```

```{r}
lubridate::ymd()
```

```{r}
df <-
data.frame(
  types = c('C','C','C','A','C','A','A','B','B','B','B','C'),
  response = c(83,59,54,68,64,88,72,73,66,94,53,55)
)

df$types |> class()

# df$types |> 
#   factor() -> df$types
df$types %<>% factor()

df$types |>  class()
```
### %T>%
```{r}
df$type |> # read: use df$type, to do factor
  factor() |> # to do table
  table()
```

```{r}
df$type |> # read: use df$type, to do factor
  factor() %T>%  # then temporarily check print, then use the earlier result
    print() |> # to do table
  table()
```

```{r}
!A == B # negate A then compare it with B
!(A == B) # compare A with B, then negate the result
```

```{r}
print(studentGradesInputFromTA == 
  studentGradesFromTeacherCalculation)
print(!(studentGradesInputFromTA == 
  studentGradesFromTeacherCalculation))

whichIsDifferent <- 
  which(
    !(studentGradesInputFromTA == 
  studentGradesFromTeacherCalculation)
  )

print(whichIsDifferent)
```

```{r}
!(studentGradesInputFromTA == 
  studentGradesFromTeacherCalculation) # the same as
studentGradesInputFromTA != 
  studentGradesFromTeacherCalculation
```

```{r}
# compare two character vectors
c("A", "B", "C") == c("B", "A", "C")
!(c("A", "B", "C") == c("B", "A", "C"))
c("A", "B", "C") != c("B", "A", "C")

# list is not atomic vector
list("John", 182, 35) == list("John", 182, 40)
```

### Recycling
```{r}
birthdays > lubridate::ymd("2002-12-31")
```

```{r}
birthdays > C(lubridate::ymd("2002-12-31"), 
              lubridate::ymd("2002-12-31"), 
              lubridate::ymd("2002-12-31"), 
              lubridate::ymd("2002-12-31"), 
              lubridate::ymd("2002-12-31"), 
              lubridate::ymd("2002-12-31"))
birthdays > rep(lubridate::ymd("2002-12-31"),6)
```

```{r}
# long vector
long_vctr = c("A", "B", "C", "D")

# short vector
short_vctr = c(1, 2)
# recycle short_vctr
short_vctr_recycles = 
  c(c(1, 2), c(1, 2))[1:4]
short_vctr_recycles

# short vector
short_vctr2 = c(1, 2, 3) # length 3
# recycle short_vctr
short_vctr_recycles2 = 
  c(c(1, 2, 3), c(1, 2, 3))[1:4]
short_vctr_recycles2
```

```{r}
vc1 = c("Apr.", "May.")
vc2 = c("1", "1")
paste(vc1, vc2)
paste(c("Apr.", "May."), c("1", "1"))
# use recycling
paste(c("Apr.", "May."), "1")
```

```{r}
rep(1998:2021, 2)
.years <- as.character(rep(1998:2021, each=2))
length(.years)

.halfYearDays <- c("01-01", "07-01")

paste(.years, .halfYearDays, sep="-")
```
